Raw description:  Magento 2.0 Enterprise: 2 years About Gap Wireless Gap Wireless is a leading provider of products and services for the mobile broadband and wireless markets. The company works with industry-recognized vendors to stock and distribute thousands of wireless infrastructure and Test & Measurement products, and offers a suite of hardware and value-added services for the UAV (Drone) inspection market. Serving carriers and contractors throughout North America. Position title:  Magento E-Commerce Administrator/Developer Reports to:  VP & GM Location:  Mississauga, Ontario Purpose:  Gap Wireless is currently seeking a fulltime Magento E-Commerce Administrator / Developer to manage our new E-Commerce site. Web Content Specialist to support our dynamic marketing team with the large number of updates required to our websites. The person will be responsible for backing up Marketing Communications with support on email campaigns as well as providing other duties to ensure that our customers receive Gap Wireless’ exemplary customer experience both online and offline. This position requires a solid understanding of Magento site administration. Primary Accountabilities:  Development experience is a plus. You will be responsible for the implementation of new features and maintenance of the website including spearheading the import of a large number of new products not currently sold on our online store. You will also work closely with digital marketing team and third-party developers to implement new features as the site evolves. This position requires a person that can work in a fast-paced environment. This role is best suited for Magento site administrator with some development experience or a Magento Developer with site administration experience. The Content Specialist will assist with and execute against projects assigned and supervised by the VP&GM; and the Marketing Communications Manager. Responsibilities include but not limited to:  · Day-to-day management of E-Commerce site operations · Serve as the first response for all technical issues regarding the website. · Develop, maintain and improve guidelines for site administration · Monitor and resolve site availability and performance issues with hosting provider · Monitor and maintain PCI compliance and security policies · Collaborate with developers to implement new features and contents · Train junior Magento site administrators and contractors · Coordinate with third party developers to implement additional features · Plan and execute minor code edits as needed · Assist with implementing digital marketing campaigns and projects · Ability to manipulate, update and write basic HTML, CSS and Java Script in order to deliver desired results in support of Marketing Communications. · Prime focal point for updating products on the website. · Provide assistance with the management of PPC campaigns as directed by the PPC team · Assist with the redesign and/or coding of various emails including triggered sends and marketing communications · Optimize design and cross-merchandising for external sites such as eBay · Provide timely updates to reports based on data extraction · Implement site content and functionality updates on a regular basis Education & Experience:  · Post-Secondary Education in a relevant fiel · 2+ years of experience managing Magento 2.0 Enterprise required · Experience in deploying and managing Magento extensions (ShipperHQ, uRapidflow, Xtento, etc…) · Must have excellent problem-solving skills · Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects in our fast-paced office · Strong organizational skills with attention to details · Experience with MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle Database a plus · Proficiency in Google Analytics, SEO, Digital marketing a plus · Experience in ERP integration a plus · Magento certification a plus Only qualified applicants will be contacted for interviews. Software skills will be tested before hiring. Please bring examples of work to any interviews/ You must have all of the experience listed above to qualify. Gap Wireless is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
